Description: Upper body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: part of glazed moulded neck ring; below, black-figure decoration consisting of bearded komast (head remaining) to left; at right, part of black handle zone.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the beard, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.130.3.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 120, pl. XXXVII) (no. 339.3)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 131, no. 16)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 232, no. 173)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.121) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4754 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
